verses.kjv: Thou shalt not sacrifice unto the LORD thy God any bullock, or sheep, wherein is blemish, or any evilfavouredness: for that is an abomination unto the LORD thy God.
verses.ct: Never offer to the LORD your God a bull or sheep that has any defect or flaw, because that is disgusting to the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: If there be found among you, within any of thy gates which the LORD thy God giveth thee, man or woman, that hath wrought wickedness in the sight of the LORD thy God, in transgressing his covenant,
verses.ct: If someone among you — a man or woman — in any of the towns that the LORD your God gives you, does something evil in the sight of the LORD your God by violating his covenant,

verses.kjv: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;
verses.ct: by going off to serve and worship other gods — whether the sun, the moon, or any of the stars in the heavens — something I never authorized,

verses.kjv: And it be told thee, and thou hast heard of it, and enquired diligently, and, behold, it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel:
verses.ct: and someone reports it to you, then you must investigate it thoroughly. If it turns out to be true and confirmed that such a disgusting thing has been done in Israel,

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou bring forth that man or that woman, which have committed that wicked thing, unto thy gates, even that man or that woman, and shalt stone them with stones, till they die.
verses.ct: you must bring that man or woman who committed this evil act to the gates of your town and execute them by stoning until they are dead.

verses.kjv: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he that is worthy of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.
verses.ct: A person may only be put to death based on the testimony of 2 or 3 witnesses. No one may be executed on the testimony of just 1 witness.

verses.kjv: The hands of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So thou shalt put the evil away from among you.
verses.ct: The witnesses must throw the first stones, and then the rest of the community joins in. In this way, you will remove the evil from among you.

verses.kjv: If there arise a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within thy gates: then shalt thou arise, and get thee up into the place which the LORD thy God shall choose;
verses.ct: If a legal case comes before you that is too difficult to decide — whether it involves a killing, a civil dispute, or an assault, any controversial matter in your towns — then you must go to the place that the LORD your God will choose.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt come unto the priests the Levites, and unto the judge that shall be in those days, and enquire; and they shall shew thee the sentence of judgment:
verses.ct: Go to the Levitical priests and to the judge serving at that time, and present your case. They will give you the ruling.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt do according to the sentence, which they of that place which the LORD shall choose shall shew thee; and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they inform thee:
verses.ct: You must carry out whatever decision they announce from the place the LORD will choose. Be careful to follow everything they instruct you to do.

verses.kjv: According to the sentence of the law which they shall teach thee, and according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, thou shalt do: thou shalt not decline from the sentence which they shall shew thee, to the right hand, nor to the left.
verses.ct: Act according to the legal instruction they teach you and the verdict they give you. Do not deviate from their ruling in any direction.

verses.kjv: And the man that will do presumptuously, and will not hearken unto the priest that standeth to minister there before the LORD thy God, or unto the judge, even that man shall die: and thou shalt put away the evil from Israel.
verses.ct: Anyone who arrogantly refuses to listen to the priest who serves there before the LORD your God, or to the judge, must be put to death. You must remove this evil from Israel.

verses.kjv: And all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
verses.ct: When everyone hears about it, they will take it seriously and never act so arrogantly again.

verses.kjv: When thou art come unto the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, and shalt possess it, and shalt dwell therein, and shalt say, I will set a king over me, like as all the nations that are about me;
verses.ct: After you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, and you take possession of it and settle there, you may say, 'Let's appoint a king over us, just like all the surrounding nations.'

verses.kjv: Thou shalt in any wise set him king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: one from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which is not thy brother.
verses.ct: You must appoint the king that the LORD your God chooses. He must be one of your own people — you are not allowed to place a foreigner over you who is not one of your brothers.

verses.kjv: But he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he should multiply horses: forasmuch as the LORD hath said unto you, Ye shall henceforth return no more that way.
verses.ct: However, the king must not acquire large numbers of horses for himself or send people back to Egypt to get more horses, because the LORD has told you, 'You must never go back that way again.'

verses.kjv: Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart turn not away: neither shall he greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
verses.ct: He must not take many wives for himself, or his heart will be led astray. He must also not accumulate excessive amounts of silver and gold.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when he sitteth upon the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him a copy of this law in a book out of that which is before the priests the Levites:
verses.ct: When he takes the throne of his kingdom, he must write out a personal copy of this law on a scroll, copying it from the one kept by the Levitical priests.

verses.kjv: And it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life: that he may learn to fear the LORD his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them:
verses.ct: He must keep it with him and read from it every day of his life, so that he learns to deeply revere the LORD his God by obeying every word of this law and these regulations,

verses.kjv: That his heart be not lifted up above his brethren, and that he turn not aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he, and his children, in the midst of Israel.
verses.ct: so that he doesn't start thinking he's better than his fellow Israelites and doesn't stray from the commandments in any direction. If he does this, he and his descendants will enjoy a long reign over his kingdom in Israel.
